1008411566851555329.text: So I’m surprised no-one has picked up on other problem here, tried to say but that’s unpossible. 1007737411017691136.text: Unique design of quasi 16650 miniUART, timing insensitivity, interrupts, dumps out a byte whenever enough bits to fill a byte are received, makes it very sensitive, receives weak transmissions, which is why it is such a little PITA about noise. A blessing, a curse , and a curse.

1007736160527925248.text: The miniUART is basically a fifo shift register, that is very timing insensitive, uses 8x oversampling, basically dumps bytes out as they accumulate. Also on owned systems, dwc_otg shows up as a _hub_ and bus master of all usb busses. (Instead of lan chip with multiple ports)

1007734041729118209.text: Let me explain a little about what is going on here, and why an interpretation of that regularlly timed bit pulse pattern as "glitches" is utterly incorrect. 960769427154247680.text: Besides securing WiFi, another reason to disable multicasting is that it frequently can be used to bypass firewalls and add "surprise" group addresses. On Linux, FreeBSD, OSX use "ip link show" to look for "extra" addresses. Use "ip link set dev <if> multicast off" to disable.
